intro: Thelocactus lophothele subsp. rinconensis, commonly known as the Rinconensis Thorned Cactus, is a rare and specialized cactus species native to a very limited geographic region in Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that are typically green to bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are often clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-drained soil and minimal water. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from habitat loss, it is considered an endangered species.
